name: market for maize grain | maize grain | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/28713/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for 'maize grain', in the geography of Nebraska state in the United States of America.;This dataset represents the transport of 1 kg of maize grain, from the production farm to the place it is later used, i.e. maize grain feed production or maize grain processing, dry milling. No losses are considered in this dataset.;The product 'maize grain' is a grain. It is an annual crop. The ecoinvent database also contains this product from organic, Swiss integrated and rainfed production.

The activity starts at the gate of maize grain cultivation farm.

This activity ends with the supply of 'maize grain', to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is the same as stated in the transforming activity for the same reference product.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data represent the situation in Nebraska state in the United States of America.

flow.name: maize grain
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

exchanges.description:
Maize grain (corn) is transported on average 354 km by lorry >32 metric ton, EURO4 (74%), train (25%) and barge (1%) in the US. Average data from 2000-2014.
References:
USDA/Agricultural Marketing Service, Transportation of U.S. Grains: A Modal Share Analysis, 1978-2011 Update
Denicoff Marina R, Prater Marvin E and Pierre Bahizi. Corn transportation profile. AMS Transportation and Marketing Programs. 2014. Available at: https://www.ams.usda.gov/sites/default/files/media/Corn%20Transportation%20Profile.pdf
Smith Timothy M. , Goodkind Andrew L., Kim Taegon, and  Schmitt Jennifer. Subnational mobility and consumption-based environmental accounting of US corn in animal protein and ethanol supply chains. Edited by Geoffrey M. Heal, Columbia University, New York, NY. 2017. https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.1703793114. Available at: https://www.pnas.org/doi/full/10.1073/pnas.1703793114#:~:text=On%20average%2C%20corn%20traveled%20%E2%88%BC,traveled%201%2C700%20miles%2C%20on%20average.
